## About this course

Urban economics explains why cities exist, how they grow, and how people and firms sort across space. We will study classic urban models, housing and labor market dynamics, transportation and congestion, neighborhood choice and segregation, and local public finance. Along the way, we will use data to connect theory to real-world patterns.

You can find the syllabus, weekly schedule, lecture notes, labs, and assignments in the navigation bar above.
